Description: Ram's head spout from large Chian, possibly black-figured, Sphinx and Lion Style, pottery open vessel, probably a bowl; yellowish cream slip; interior: glazed streaky black on inner surface and in spout; exterior: on rim, band of short vertical lines; lines on surface of modelled horns; dots on face and under head of ram.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Chian artists working in the Sphinx and Lion Style produced a wide range of unique shapes not found in other Chian styles.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 58, no. 6, pl. VI)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2041) (phase 2)
